items.title: Segway offers up to 50% savings on its Lumina and Cube power stations + accessories starting from $130
items.summary:
Segway is currently offering up to 50% savings on its power stations, like the latest Lumina 500 Portable Power Station at $179.99 shipped, which also matches its current Amazon pricing. While it carries a $400 MSRP direct from the brand, you can more often find it starting around $300, with the discounts we’ve seen on it going as low as $170 so far in its history. That means you’re getting the second-best rate with the deals here, saving you $120 ($220 off the MSRP) and giving you an ample, but compact, backup power companion for devices and small appliances. Below, you’ll also find the brand’s larger 1,024Wh and 2,048Wh models down at some of their best prices, too, along with accessories like expansion batteries and solar panels.

more…

items.title: Anker packs 26,250mAh capacity, 300W charging, and an onboard display in its Prime power bank at $171 (Reg. $230)
items.summary:
Through the official Anker Amazon storefront, you can currently get Christmas shopping prices once again on the Prime 26,250mAh 3-Port 300W Power Bank for $171.48 shipped, which comes in $1 under the direct website pricing we’re seeing. Down off its full $230 rate, we’ve seen discounts at Amazon take things as low as $160, which was last seen during Black Friday, while today’s rate last appeared during Christmas sales. You’re getting another shot at the third-best price we have tracked from Amazon here, giving you a significantly larger backup power companion for your personal devices with $59 cut from the going rate. You can also get some solid support with a bit more savings by going with its Prime 21,100mAh 3-Port 220W counterpart at $150 right now, too.

more…

items.title: Get up to 40.4 miles of travel on the budget-friendly Hiboy S2 Max e-scooter at $495, more from $300
items.summary:
Amazon is currently offering commuters a more affordable way to get around with Hiboy’s S2 Max Electric Scooter down at $494.98 shipped, matching the direct pricing we’re seeing from the brand’s website. This long-distance budget-friendly commuter carries an $835 MSRP direct from the brand, and can be found starting far lower at Amazon for $590, though recently it’s been keeping between $520 and $495. While we have seen it go as low as $472 in the past, you’re still getting one of its next-best rates here, courtesy of the $95 markdown off Amazon’s starting rate (and $340 off the MSRP). If you don’t need the longer travel distance on this model and want to save more, you can also find the Hiboy S2 Electric Scooter holding strong at $299.97 shipped, since coming down from $420 back in December.

It briefly hit $60 earlier this month before selling out, and today’s deal lands it within just $1 of that price, making it a good time to cash in.
